intro: Cromidon microechinos, commonly known as the small-echinose cromidon, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it a subject of interest for botanists studying rare flora. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered vulnerable to habitat loss and environmental changes.
